TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {59187=§ 2330 - Procurement of contract services: management structure, 59962=§ 2335 - Prohibition on collection of political information, 60083=§ 2336, 14022=DoD, GSA, and NASA are issuing an interim rule amending the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to implement Executive Order (E.O.) 13672, “Further Amendments to Executive Order 11478, Equal Employment Opportunity in the Federal Government, and Executive Order 11246, Equal Employment Opportunity,” and a final rule issued by the Department of Labor (DOL)., 59846=§ 2334 - Independent cost estimation and cost analysis, 56563=§ 2310 - Determinations and decisions, 58832=§ 2327 - Contracts: consideration of national security objectives, 56268=§ 2307 - Contract financing, 58714=§ 2326 - Undefinitized contractual actions: restrictions, 56804=§ 2312 - Remission of liquidated damages, 55585=§ 2305 - Contracts: planning, solicitation, evaluation, and award procedures, 55829=§ 2306 - Kinds of contracts, 59107=§ 2329 - Repealed., 104000=DoD, GSA, and NASA are proposing to amend the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to implement a section of the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) for Fiscal Year (FY) 2013 to include in the Federal Awardee Performance and Integrity Information System (FAPIIS), to the extent practicable, identification of any immediate owner or subsidiary, and all predecessors of an offeror that held a Federal contract or grant within the last three years. The objective is to provide a more comprehensive understanding of the performance and integrity of the corporation before awarding a Federal contract., 56357=§ 2308 - Buy-to-budget acquisition: end items, 54629=§ 2303 - Applicability of chapter, 59673=§ 2333 - Joint policies on requirements definition, contingency program management, and contingency contracting, 58624=§ 2325 - Restructuring costs, 19533=DoD, GSA, and NASA are issuing corrections to FAR Case 2013-001; Ending Trafficking in Persons (Item I), which was published in the Federal Register at 80 FR 4967, January 29, 2015., 54806=§ 2304 - Contracts: competition requirements, 25038=DoD, GSA, and NASA are issuing a final rule amending the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to strengthen protections against trafficking in persons in Federal contracts. These changes are intended to implement Executive Order (E.O.) 13627, entitled “Strengthening Protections Against Trafficking in Persons in Federal Contracts,” and title XVII of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2013., 57560=§ 2317 - Repealed., 58514=§ 2324 - Allowable costs under defense contracts, 57736=§ 2319 - Encouragement of new competitors, 56906=§ 2313 - Examination of records of contractor, 54080=§ 2302 - Definitions, 57934=§ 2321 - Validation of proprietary data restrictions, 57453=§ 2316 - Disclosure of identity of contractor, 53924=§ 2301 - Repealed. L. 103–355 , title I , § 1501(a), Oct. 13, 1994, 108 Stat. 3296 ], 60174=§ 2337 - Life-cycle management and product support, 58048=§ 2322 - Repealed., 58959=§ 2328 - Release of technical data under Freedom of Information Act: recovery of costs, 58128=§ 2323 - Contract goal for small disadvantaged businesses and certain institutions of higher education, 57130=§ 2314 - Laws inapplicable to agencies named in section 2303 of this title, 59576=§ 2332 - Share-in-savings contracts, 61317=Title 48 published on 2014-10-01, 109464=DoD, GSA, and NASA are proposing to amend the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to further implement the inflation adjustment of acquisition-related dollar thresholds. A statute requires an adjustment every five years of acquisition-related thresholds for inflation using the Consumer Price Index for all urban consumers, except for the Construction Wage Rate Requirements statute (Davis-Bacon Act), Service Contract Labor Standards statute, and trade agreements thresholds. DoD, GSA, and NASA are also proposing to use the same methodology to adjust nonstatutory FAR acquisition-related thresholds in 2015., 56464=§ 2309 - Allocation of appropriations, 56662=§ 2311 - Assignment and delegation of procurement functions and responsibilities, 57640=§ 2318 - Advocates for competition, 57266=§ 2315 - Law inapplicable to the procurement of automatic data processing equipment and services for certain defense purposes, 59431=§ 2331 - Procurement of services: contracts for professional and technical services, 57839=§ 2320 - Rights in technical data}

textAfterTable: DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE, GENERAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION, NATIONAL AERONAUTICS AND SPACE ADMINISTRATION Final rule. Effective: May 7, 2015. 48 CFR Parts 1, 22, and 52 Summary DoD, GSA, and NASA have adopted as final, without change, an interim rule amending the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to implement final rules issued by the Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs at the Department of Labor (DOL) relating to equal opportunity and affirmative action for veterans and individuals with disabilities. 80 FR 26427 - Federal Acquisition Regulation; Technical Amendments GPO FDSys XML | Text Additional Documents type regulations.gov FR Doc. 2015-11031 RIN Item IV Sequence No. 1 FAC 2005-82 Docket No. 2015-0052 DEPARTMENT OF
